answers.text:
When you get these, could you forward to me please? We just had this come up in my organization for an IT professional for training that is going to cost $8,000, we are struggling because we do not have a policy that addresses this and we this employee needs this training for our new IT network to be successful.
My recommendation has been to pay for the training and get a policy in place to address the next employee, and hope for the best on this particular employee.

answers.text:
The City of Virginia Beach (Regina Hilliard) tells me that they do have a payback provision in the Tuition Reimbursement Policy, and has provided a segment of the policy below:
4.3 Conditional Policy for Tuition Reimbursement
Tuition reimbursement shall be conditioned on the employee's completion of a minimum of one (1) year of employment with the City or Constitutional Office beginning on the date the employee received the last payment of tuition reimbursement from the City hereinafter referred to as the conditional employment period. Employees who terminate before completion of the conditional employment period shall reimburse the City for tuition reimbursement received during the 12 months immediately preceding the last day of employment as follows:
A. 100% when termination occurs within one (1) to ninety (90) days after receiving the last payment of tuition reimbursement;
B. 75% when termination occurs within ninety one (91) to one hundred eighty (180) days after receiving the last payment of tuition reimbursement;
C. 50% when termination occurs within one hundred eighty one (181) to two hundred seventy (270) days after receiving the last payment of tuition reimbursement; OR
D. 25% when termination occurs within two hundred seventy one (271) to three hundred sixty four (364) days after receiving the last payment of tuition reimbursement.

text: I'm looking for cities or counties that have developed effective payback agreements for the expesnes associated with major training.  You know the type - "employee must work for the organization for 2 years beyond the conclusion of the training, or repay the expense of $XX on agraduated (pro-rata) scale."
title: Training Expense Payback Contracts
